findings.title: Reentrancy Vulnerability in withdraw()
findings.description: External call before state update allows reentrant calls. An attacker can recursively call withdraw() before the balance is updated.
findings.remediation: Apply the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern. Update state variables before making external calls.

findings.title: Unrestricted setBalance() Function
findings.description: Missing access control allows any address to modify user balances arbitrarily.
findings.remediation: Add onlyOwner modifier or implement role-based access control (RBAC).

findings.title: Reentrancy Attack Path Confirmed
findings.description: Symbolic execution confirmed exploitable reentrancy path with concrete attack transaction.
findings.remediation: Use ReentrancyGuard from OpenZeppelin or apply CEI pattern.

findings.title: Block Timestamp Dependence
findings.description: Timestamp can be manipulated by miners within a ~15 second window.
findings.remediation: Avoid using block.timestamp for critical logic. Use block.number instead.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: setBalance() does not validate that the user address is not zero.
